benchmark_details.name: MedAgentBoard
benchmark_details.overview: MedAgentBoard serves as a comprehensive benchmark for the evaluation of multi-agent collaboration, single LLM and conventional methods across diverse medical tasks, addressing gaps in generalizability and completeness.
benchmark_details.data_type: text, medical images, structured EHR data

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation of multi-agent collaboration, single large language models, and conventional approaches across various medical tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The study highlights that multi-agent collaboration does not universally outperform advanced single LLMs or specialized conventional methods.

data.source: Publicly available datasets for medical tasks including MedQA, PubMedQA, PathVQA, VQA-RAD, Cochrane, eLife, PLOS, Med-EASi, and TJH.
data.annotation: Data annotation methods vary depending on the dataset (e.g., expert-annotated summaries, structured clinical data).

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated according to standard evaluation protocols for the respective tasks.
methodology.interpretation: The results can be interpreted by comparing the performance of multi-agent collaboration and LLMs against strong conventional baselines.
methodology.baseline_results: Comprehensive results across all evaluated tasks, showcasing the strengths and weaknesses of each method.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments designed to ensure the robustness and validity of the benchmark.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All datasets used are publicly available or accessible upon request and were employed under their respective licenses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Datasets are used following their respective licenses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: None applicable as no new patient data was collected.
